com.android.build.transform.api
Interface CombinedTransform

All Superinterfaces:
Transform
public interface CombinedTransform
extends Transform

A Transform that combines all the input streams into a single output stream.

Method Detail

transform

void transform(@NonNull
               java.util.Collection<TransformInput> inputs,
               @NonNull
               java.util.Collection<TransformInput> referencedInputs,
               @NonNull
               TransformOutput output,
               boolean isIncremental)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      TransformException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
Perform the Transform. There is a single TransformOutput for the whole transform. The Transform can require a non-incremental changes, either because Transform.isIncremental() returns false, or because there is a change in secondary files (as returned by Transform.getSecondaryFileInputs()), or a change to non input file parameters (as returned by Transform.getParameterInputs()), or an output was clobbered by something. If this happens then isIncremental will be false, and TransformInput.getChangedFiles() will return an empty map. In that case, the transform should look directly at TransformInput.getFiles() to find the files. This is different from Gradle's behavior where clean builds receive all files in the changed file list.

Parameters:
inputs - the inputs/outputs of the transform
referencedInputs - the referenced-only inputs
isIncremental - whether the transform is incremental.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
java.lang.InterruptedException
TransformException - Generic exception encapsulating the cause.
